articles.title: Congratulations to Portuguese President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Portuguese President
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Marcelo Rebelo De Sousa upon his election as president of the Portuguese Republic.
					 Expressing the belief that the relations between the two countries would develop in the common interests, the message wished the president success in his work for the country's development and prosperity.

articles.title: GFSTK Enlarged Plenary Meeting Held
articles.content:
GFSTK Enlarged Plenary Meeting Held
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea (GFSTK) held its 54th enlarged plenary meeting at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday.
					 Present at the meeting were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), permanent members, members and alternate members of the C.C., the GFSTK, officials of associations and societies and officials of the general federation in the capital and local areas.
					
					 The meeting discussed the tasks of the committees of all levels, associations and societies to carry out without fail the tasks set forth by Marshal Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address.
					
					 Vice-Chairman of the C.C., the general federation Kye Hui Nam made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers proposed the tasks and ways to bring about a fresh turn in developing the national economy and improving the people's standard of living by dint of science and technology true to the intention of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They called for making signal achievements in the science and technology activities and researches this year and thus make positive contributions to glorifying the Seventh Congress of the WPK as the one of victors and honor.

articles.title: Enlarged Plenary Meeting of DWUK Held
articles.content:
Enlarged Plenary Meeting of DWUK Held
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- The 72nd enlarged plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) was held here on Wednesday
					 It was attended by members and alternate members of the C.C., the women's union and its officials in the capital and local areas.
					
					 It discussed the issue of thoroughly implementing the tasks set forth by Marshal Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address for 2016.
					
					 Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the C.C., the women's union, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that the historic New Year Address of the Marshal serves as a militant banner as it clearly indicates the tasks for this year and ways of glorifying the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea as a congress of victors and honor and ushering in the greatest heyday in building a thriving nation.
					
					 They called upon all the officials and members of the women's union to devotedly implement the important tasks set forth by the Marshal in his New Year Address and bring about a dramatic turn in the work of the women's union and thus make positive contributions to brilliantly adorning this year when the 7th Congress of the WPK is to be held.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- An art troupe of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star headed by Jang Ki Saeng visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Wednesday.
					 The members of the art troupe laid bouquets before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Software for Oral Exam Developed
articles.content:
Software for Oral Exam Developed
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Chaek University of Technology has recently developed a software for oral exam to be helpful to evaluating students' ability.
					 It allows many students to apply for oral exam simultaneously and can produce the result in a few minutes.
					
					 It has already been applied to examinations in different subjects, including mathematical analysis, physics and chemistry.

articles.title: Construction of School Buildings Makes Headway in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Construction of School Buildings Makes Headway in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A work to build or expand school buildings is progressing rapidly in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK.
					 According to an official concerned, such project is aimed to provide better educational conditions in keeping with the enforcement of the universal 12-year compulsory education in the country.
					
					 Sosong District of the city finished the construction of a new building for Janggyong Primary School in a short span of time, while Moranbong District turned out to erect a building for Songbuk Primary School after completing the construction of Sohung and Minhung primary schools on an expansion basis.
					
					 Similar projects are being accelerated at a fast tempo in Taesong, Mangyongdae, Phyongchon and other districts, too, with a goal to finish them before the start of a new school year.
					
					 Meanwhile, Munhung Senior Secondary School in Taedonggang District has put the whole course of practice education on an IT basis.

articles.title: Restaurant Famed for Catfish Cuisines
articles.content:
Restaurant Famed for Catfish Cuisines
Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- The restaurant under the Pyongyang Seafoods Department Store is at the height of fame for serving 40 kinds of catfish cuisines.
					Jong Myong Ok, a head cook of the restaurant, told KCNA that the cuisines include soup, stew, grill and hard-boiled catfish.
					
					She said that the restaurant presented six kinds of catfish cuisines to the catfish cooking competition in the public catering field of Pyongyang held at the Pyongyang Noodle House some days ago.
					
					Those cuisines have won high appraisal at the competition, she added.
					
					The restaurant is located at the entrance of Okryu Bridge in Pyongyang.

articles.title: 21st Century Will Witness U.S. Going to Ruin: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
21st Century Will Witness U.S. Going to Ruin: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- In recent years tories about the end of the U.S.-led era and its downfall, etc. have been heard from different parts of the world without let-up. The U.S. rulers and monopoly capitalists dare not deny such arguments. This being a hard reality, they shamelessly claim that the U.S. will continue leading the world in the 21st century, too. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 No matter what means the U.S. leaves untried, it can never check its decline and ruin.
					
					 The U.S. is called a medley of different human races. It is supported by dollars and nuclear weapons. With these two pillars at peril, the U.S. is shaking to its very foundation. 
					
					 The U.S. ruling quarters are bringing an excessive burden of taxes upon the people to keep the monopoly capitalists afloat in a bid to save their country from the abyss of ruin. 
					
					 That is why broad strata of toiling masses are staging endless demonstrations in protest against the government's step to increase the taxes.
					
					 A scramble is getting very fierce between the Republican Party and the Democratic Party over the state budget, healthcare insurance, immigration reform, etc., in the U.S. saddled with debts running into astronomical figures. State governments are taking an increasing number of independent steps in protest against the instructions of the federal government.
					
					 The U.S., chieftain of the world imperialists, is finding itself in such difficult position that it is hard for it to escape the fate of destruction, 
					
					 The world will clearly see the doom of the U.S. in the 21st century.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Spirit of Self-Development in DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Spirit of Self-Development in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- The DPRK has raced against time and made a leap forward, weathering the worst hardships and difficulties. This is entirely possible because it has worked hard, regarding the spirit of self-development as a weapon for winning a sure victory. Rodong Sinmun says this in an article on Wednesday.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The spirit of self-development of which the Korean people feel proud is the Juche-oriented power provided by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Holding high the banner of the Juche idea, the Korean people made Yanji bomb from scratch with neither state support nor assistance from a regular army to beat down the gangster-like Japanese imperialists and completed the post-war rehabilitation and construction in just a few years, dealing a sledge-hammer blow at the heads of the U.S. imperialists who claimed the DPRK could not stand on its feet from war debris even in a hundred years. They also worked such a miracle as carrying out the historic task of socialist industrialization in a matter of 14 years.
					
					 They successfully made the Arduous March, forced march, which might cause others to fall a hundred times and laid down a firm springboard for building a thriving nation. This would be unthinkable without the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea which instilled the spirit of self-development into the people as a mainstay of faith.
					
					 The conditions and circumstances of the revolutionary struggle may alter and the old generation may be replaced by a new one as the times and history advance. But the Korean people remain unchanged in their faith and will to build the best and strongest nation on this land under the leadership of the party, holding high the banner of self-development provided by the great leaders.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Japanese Politicians' Outbursts about Victims of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Japanese Politicians' Outbursts about Victims of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army 
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- Recently Yoshitaka Sakurada, dietman from the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan who was former vice-minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan, at a joint meeting of his party on diplomatic relations insulted victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army by calling them "professional prostitutes" and claimed that "Japan is being seriously deceived by the propaganda for painting them as victims." Meanwhile, the present Japanese chief executive talked nonsense at the Diet that there is no evidence proving that the Imperial Japanese Army forced women into sexual slavery.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Wednesday says that such thoughtless remarks made by the Japanese politicians at a time when the issue of liquidating Japan's past crimes is being discussed as a crucial matter go to prove that Japan remains unchanged in its wrong way of thinking about its past crimes.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army are the miserable women who have lived in disgrace and pain as their chastity was violated by its beast-like service personnel, subject to all sorts of maltreatment and humiliation after being drafted by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 This being a hard fact, the Japanese politicians insulted them by calling them "prostitutes", far from uttering words of apology to them. They are not human beings. What they uttered is a criminal act of insulting once again the above-said victims. The recent reckless remarks made by the Japanese reactionaries are nothing but disgraceful behaviors of those worse than beasts and mentally deranged guys.
					
					 The issue of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army is a crucial political task to be settled by the Japanese government in a responsible manner as it is a hideous crime committed against humanity in wanton breach of the women's dignity.

articles.title: KCTU Declares General Strike in Protest against Authorities' Retrogressive Revision of Labor Law
articles.content:
KCTU Declares General Strike in Protest against Authorities' Retrogressive Revision of Labor Law
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) on January 23 declared a general strike in  protest against the authorities' announcement of the guidelines for the retrogressive revision of the labor law. 
					 That day the KCTU held a meeting to declare a general strike in Seoul. 
					
					 At the end of the meeting at Seoul Railway Station its participants staged a demonstration as far as Seoul Square. 
					
					 Then more than 5,000 unionists held a rally there for declaring a general strike to hold in check the retrogressive revision of the labor law and shatter the "government's" guidelines. 
					
					 They declared they would kick off a general strike on January 25.

articles.title: Final Ruin of U.S. Is Matter of Time: S. Korean Newspaper
articles.content:
Final Ruin of U.S. Is Matter of Time: S. Korean Newspaper
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- An article titled "It is a matter of time for the U.S. to go to ruin just like the case of Pueblo" was posted on the south Korean internet newspaper Jaju Sibo on Jan. 24.
					 The article said that Jan. 23 marks the 48th anniversary of the case in which a touch-and-go situation was created between the DPRK and the U.S. due to the former's capture of the latter's armed spy ship Pueblo.
					
					 In recent days the DPRK has noted that the final failure of the U.S. hostile policy toward it is a matter of time, warning the U.S. that it would meet a final doom, if it makes another reckless provocation against the DPRK, far from drawing a bitter lesson from the history of the bilateral relations.
					
					 The article stressed that when viewing the DPRK's recent proposal for concluding a peace treaty in linkage with the lesson taught by the case of Pueblo, it is little short of warning that the U.S. earliest possible signing of the peace treaty is beneficial to its national interests but any delay would bring more shameful fiasco to it.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Sycophancy and Treachery Accused by S. Korean Newspaper
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Sycophancy and Treachery Accused by S. Korean Newspaper
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Minjok Ilbo in an editorial on Jan. 23 accused the authorities of such sycophantic and treacherous act as conniving at the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces' introduction of germ weapons, sparking off public anger at home and abroad.
					 It was disclosed that the authorities kept mum about the U.S. forces' introduction of pest germs, though they were aware of it, the editorial noted.
					
					 As soon as the fact was disclosed, the authorities stated that "they had already knew about the introduction of the pest germ but were late in making public the fact in order to make the people hear the correct result of the ample investigation into it", the editorial said. 
					
					 As was brought to light by the recent case, the Park Geun Hye's regime's sycophancy towards the U.S. has gone beyond the tolerance limit.

articles.title: Indefinite General Strike Starts against Authorities' Guidelines for Retrogressive Revision of Labor Law
articles.content:
Indefinite General Strike Starts against Authorities' Guidelines for Retrogressive Revision of Labor Law
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) launched an indefinite general strike for shattering the authorities' guidelines for retrogressive revision of the labor law on Jan. 25, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People.
					 Unionists of the Seoul, Kyonggi and Inchon headquarters of the KCTU held a rally for general strike outside the Seoul District Agency of Employment and Labor that day.
					
					 Speakers recalled that the "government" announced the "double guidelines" for making the layoff of workers easier.
					
					 The "government" announced the guidelines for retrogressive revision of the labor law despite the people's opposition, fully revealing their unpopular nature, they charged.
					
					 They called for making 2016 a year of workers' victory.
					
					 At the end of the rally its participants continued protest action.
					
					 That day the KCTU held rallies and press conferences across south Korea, centering on 16 regional headquarters, and declared an indefinite general strike.

articles.title: Biting Cold and Heavy Snow Hit S. Korea
articles.content:
Biting Cold and Heavy Snow Hit S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- South Korea is hit hard by consecutive days of biting cold and heavy snow, according to the south Korean KBS. 
					 An old person in the sixties, a poor waste paper collector, fell on street to die of severe cold in Talso District, Taegu City on Jan. 24.
					
					 Casualties occurred in Kijang County and So District, Pusan City that day.
					
					 Meanwhile, heavy snow hit different areas, causing more than 40 plastic houses and many domestic animal pens to collapse in South Chungchong, North and South Jolla provinces.
					
					 Jeju Island was also hit by heavy snow.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked by Communist Party of Germany
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked by Communist Party of Germany
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated by the Communist Party of Germany on Jan. 21.
					 Chairman of the party Torsten Schoevitz was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize significant political and cultural events such as a meeting, seminar, round-table talks and film show from Jan. 21 to Feb. 16 to mark the 74th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Italy
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Italy
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- An Italian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated in Milano on Jan. 21.
					 The chief of the Milano Center for the Study of the Juche Idea who doubles as official representative of the Italian Branch of the Korean Friendship Association was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold political and cultural events in praise of the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il to mark the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Hungary
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Hungary
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A Hungarian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated in Budapest on Jan. 21.
					 Gyula Thurmer, chairman of the Hungarian Workers' Party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to fix the celebration period from Jan. 21 to April 17 and hold diverse events in praise of the revolutionary careers and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in the capital and local areas.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Switzerland
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A Swiss preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated in Basel on Jan. 21.
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give publicity to Kim Jong Il's works and greatness and arrange a meeting, film show, seminar and other diverse political and cultural events from Jan. 24 to Feb. 17.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Tajikistan
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Tajikistan
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A Tajik preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated in Dushanbe on Jan. 21.
					 Sh. Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to arrange diverse political and cultural events in praise of the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il to mark the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Uganda
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Uganda
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A Ugandan national preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated in Kampala on Jan. 21.
					 Henri Masico, department director of the Ugandan Presidency, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to arrange a meeting, photo exhibition, film show and other diverse political and cultural events to mark the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: DPRK Has Access to Nuclear Deterrent by Itself: Egyptian Newspaper
articles.content:
DPRK Has Access to Nuclear Deterrent by Itself: Egyptian Newspaper
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- The Jan. 13th issue of the Egyptian newspaper Al-Ahram carried an article on the DPRK's successful first H-bomb test.
					 It said that it is clear to everybody that the DPRK's H-bomb test is a matter pertaining to its right as it withdrew from the NPT already in 2003.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Thanks to the DPRK's efforts for putting an end to the U.S. nuclear threat against it and realizing the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, the DPRK-U.S. Agreed Framework was adopted and agreements were made at the six-party talks. However, such agreements were reduced to the dead papers due to the U.S. and its followers. A particular mention should be made of the fact that the U.S. listed the DPRK as part of the "axis of evil" and designated the latter as a target of its preemptive nuclear strike and has gotten more frantic with its moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 Had the DPRK failed to have access to nuclear weapons, it would not have defended itself from the U.S. aggression but would have faced the same fate as Iraq's.
					
					 The permanent members of the UNSC have massively stockpiled nuclear weapons.
					
					 The DPRK had access to the nuclear deterrent by itself.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded by Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded by Swiss Organizations
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was the great brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu, outstanding statesman and gifted thinker and theoretician.
					 So said a statement issued at the inaugural ceremony of the Swiss preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) held on Jan. 21. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il applied the Juche idea and Songun idea fathered by President Kim Il Sung to the revolution and construction and formulated the Songun politics as a fundamental political mode of socialist Korea, the statement added.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Under his wise leadership, the DPRK emerged a nuclear weapons state and satellite manufacturer and launcher.
					
					 Kim Jong Il made great contributions to accomplishing the cause of the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and conducted energetic activities for the people's happiness, regarding it as his motto to believe in the people as in Heaven.
					
					 We formed the preparatory committee for significantly celebrating the Day of the Shining Star, a holiday common to humankind, with boundless reverence for Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were figures and members of the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea.

articles.title: Tiene lugar reunion ampliada de 54a sesion plenaria de CC de FGCTC
articles.content:
Tiene lugar reunion ampliada de 54a sesion plenaria de CC de FGCTC
Pyongyang, 27 de enero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 27 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo la reunion ampliada de 54a sesion plenaria del Comite Central de la Federacion General de Ciencia y Tecnica de Corea.
					Asistieron a la ocasion Choe Thae Bok, secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, los miembros permanentes, miembros y los miembros suplentes, del CC de la FGCTC, y otros funcionarios correspondientes.
					
					En la ocasion se debatieron los problemas para materializar estrictamente las tareas presentadas por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un en su Mensaje del Ano Nuevo.
					
					Hubo el informe del vicepresidente del CC de la FGCTC, Kye Hui Nam, e intervenciones.
					
					Los oradores presentaron las tareas y remedios que se presentan en el trabajo para levantar el nuevo viraje en el desarrollo de la economia del pais y el mejoramiento de vida del pueblo con el poderio de las ciencias y tecnicas en pleno acato al proposito del Mariscal.
					
					Enfatizaron en la necesidad de registrar cambios en las actividades cientificas y tecnicas y las investigaciones para hacer activa contribucion a decorar el VII Congreso del PTC como el de triunfadores y de gloria.

articles.title: Efectuada reunion ampliada de 72a sesion plenaria del CC de UMDC
articles.content:
Efectuada reunion ampliada de 72a sesion plenaria del CC de UMDC
Pyongyang, 27 de enero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 27 en esta capital la reunion ampliada de la 72a sesion plenaria del Comite Central de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea.
					Estuvieron presentes miembros y miembros suplentes del CC del UMDC y las funcionarias de esta organizacion de mujeres del centro y localidades.
					
					En la ocasion deliberaron los problemas para cumplir las tareas presentadas por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un en su Mensaje de Ano Nuevo 2016.
					
					La presidenta del CC de la UMDC, Kim Jong Sun, pronuncio el informe de la ocasion y otras intervinieron.
					
					Los oradores dijeron que el historico Mensaje de Ano Nuevo del Mariscal es la bandera combativa que ilumina las tareas y los remedios del presente ano para hacer del VII Congreso del PTC el evento de triunfadores y de gloria y abrir la era dorada de la construccion de un Estado prospero.
					
					Enfatizaron que todas las funcionarias e integrantes de la UMDC deben materializar cabalmente las tareas programaticas presentadas por el Mariscal en el Mensaje del Ano Nuevo y registrar innovacion fundamental en las labores de la union, para hacer activa contribucion a coronar el presente ano en que se convocara el VII Congreso del PTC.

articles.title: Logrado exito en la operacion de disociacion aortica
articles.content:
Logrado exito en la operacion de disociacion aortica
Pyongyang, 27 de enero (ACNC) -- Recientemente, en el hospital cardiologo del Hospital Universal de la Cruz Roja de Corea se alcanzo exito en la primera operacion de la repentina disociacion aortica.
					El vicepresidente cientifico, Kim Yong Chol, dijo a la ACNC como sigue:
					
					El presente exito medico tiene considerable significacion en el desarrollo de la cirugia cardiovascular del pais, porque abrio una brecha en elevar el nivel tecnico de la cirugia vascular que espera la resolucion en la practica de la salud publica.
					
					La operacion es monopolizada por unos paises medicamente desarrollados.
					
					La mortalidad por esta enfermedad llega a 90% dentro de un mes despues de aparicion de la enfermedad.
					
					La enfermedad aparece a la edad de 50-60 anos a causa de la hipertension y se puede curar con la operacion quirurgica.
					
					El colectivo medico invento el metodo de operacion a nuestro estilo y lo aplico a una mujer de 59 anos de edad con esta enfermedad.
					
					Despues de la operacion, la enferma se libero totalmente de la peligrosidad de la rotura de aortas.
					
					A traves de la operacion, hemos adquirido la tecnologia de anestesia, operacion, circulacion extracorporal y asistencia a los enfermos despues de la operacion.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena disparates de politicos japoneses
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena disparates de politicos japoneses
Pyongyang, 27 de enero (ACNC) -- Hace poco, Yoshitaka Sakurada, parlamentario del Partido Democratico Liberal y ex viceministro de Educacion, Cultura, Deporte, Ciencia y Tecnologia de Japon, en la reunion conjunta de los relacionados con la  diplomacia del dicho partido, insulto a las victimas de la esclavitud sexual del ex ejercito japones calificandolas de "prostitutas profesionales" y pronuncio disparates de que Japon "esta enganada mucho por las actividades de propaganda que les tratan como victimas".
					 Por otra parte, el gobernador japones picoteo, en la dieta, que no hay pruebas de que el ejercito japones les arresto a  fuerza como esclavas sexuales.
					
					 Tales disparates pronunciados por los politiqueros japoneses pronunciados cuando la liquidacion del pasado de Japon se discute como problema importante, demuestran que no hay ningun cambio en el pensamiento erroneo de Japon con respecto al crimen del pasado.
					
					  Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este miercoles y prosigue:
					
					ã€€Las victimas de la esclavitud sexual del ex ejercito japones son las mujeres pobres que fueron arrestadas a fuerza por los imperialistas japoneses y violadas por los soldados japoneses barbaros bajo el maltrato y desprecio de toda indole y han venido viviendo infelizmente con el agravio y el sufrimiento.
					
					  Sin embargo, insulto a ellas como "prostitutas" lejos de  pedir disculpas, lo cual deviene otro acto criminal que  deshonra otra vez a esas victimas.
					
					  Los disparates de los reaccionarios japoneses significan la conducta grosera de las bestias que ya perdieron lo todo del hombre y de los psicopatas que perdieron la capacidad del pensamiento sano.
					
					  El crimen de la esclavitud sexual del ex ejercito japones es el antietico de gran tamano, que pisoteo despiadadamente la dignidad de las mujeres, y una tarea politica importante a ser responsabilizada y resuelta por el Estado japones.
